description.narrative:
Insatsen avser stöd till UNDP:s regionala kontor i Bangkok för en planeringsfas om 12 månader med start juni 2017 för att förbereda ett större program med syfte att stödja implementering av FN:s principer för företag och mänskliga rättigheter (UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights) som UNDP avser att leda och implementera i samarbete med andra FN-organ och aktörer. UNDP har identifierat FN:s principer för företag och mänskliga rättigheter som ett område som möjliggör arbete på ett integrerat sätt med flera av deras kärnområden; mänskliga rättigheter, konfliktprevention, miljöskydd och jämställdhet i Sydostasien, Sydasien och Oceanien.
Under planeringsfasen ska UNDP identifiera förutsättningar för, och aktörer som tillsammans kan planera och driva ett framtida fyraårigt program för implementering av FN:s principer för företag och mänskliga rättigheter på regional och nationell nivå i Asien och Oceanien. Syftet är att utveckla en mekanism för samarbete mellan FN-organ och andra aktörer som kan leda genomförande av FN:s principer. Aktiviteter planeras för att identifiera huvudsakliga utmaningar, konsultera och hitta samarbetsmöjligheter med aktörer inom Sydostasien, Sydasien och Oceanien och utveckla en inkluderande partnerskapsstruktur för implementering. UNDP planerar också att stödja två pilotländer; Thailand och Filippinerna, vilka direkt efterfrågat UNDP:s stöd, att utveckla nationella handlingsplaner för företag och mänskliga rättigheter.

Support to UNDP's regional office in Bangkok for work on UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights attached. The support covers one year preparatory work for a comprehensive regional program to support the implementation of Action Plans at national and regional level in South Asia, Pacific but with focus on Southeast Asia. The preparation phase shall 1) identify cross-border challenges where cooperation between countries is important and 2) identify partnership mechanisms for sub-regional collaboration on Regional and National Action Plans for Business and Human Rights.
During the preparatory phase UNDP will also support a few individual countries, including the Philippines, Thailand and Malaysia, which have requested UNDP’s support for development of National Action Plans.

description.narrative: This contribution was for the scoping phase of 'Business and Human Rights in Asia' (B+HR Asia) proposed and implemented by UNDP Regional Hub in Bangkok. The Contribution was originally made for 12 months until 31 May 2018 then it was fiscally-neutral extended until 31 July 2018 when the implementation phase of B+HR Asia programme started. During the 14 months, consultation visits and comprehensive activities with the countries in Southeast Asia and South Asia were undertaken to raise awareness on UNGP B+HR, build up the dynamics as well as to determine the level of interest and capacity of potential countries for the programme implementation. Results; Following a series of activities in the scoping phase, positive responses and trend towards the UNGP BHR in Southeast Asia and South Asia can be witnessed. A wide range of stakeholders including Governments, National Human Right Commission (NHRC), businesses and CSOs are interested in this issue. The activities undertaken in the scoping phase successfully convened multi-stakeholders for open discussions ebabling the positive so created the dynamics in the region. Technical support and policy advice were provided to the Ministry of Justice of Thailand in the development and drafting of the National Action Plan for B+HR. The programme also offered advice to the government of relevant countries on the process and roadmap towards UNGP BHR. Regional activities were pursued such as, the B+HR Lab, workshops co-organised with ASEAN Inter-governmental Commissioner on Human Rights and B+HR through Gender Lens in New Delhi. These events were open to participants from all countries in Asia. This method succesfully encouraged network-buidling and South-South peer learning across the countries in Asia. The submission of the intervention proposal for the full implmentation of UNGP Business and Human Rights Asia (B+HR Asia) by UNDP with the targeted 7 countries of implementation including Thailand, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, India and Bangladesh. Unexpected results; The interest towards B+HR from stakeholders in Asia grows at a faster-paced than expected. Countries that show interest in B+HR are beyond the geographical coverage of the subsequent implmentation by the programme.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
